title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee - Wikipedia
snippet: Atal Bihari Vajpayee (25 December 1924 – 16 August 2018) was an Indian poet, writer and statesman who served as the prime minister of India, first for a term of 13 days in 1996, then for a period of 13 months from 1998 to 1999, followed by a full term from 1999 to 2004.

snippet: Atal Bihari Vajpayee (born December ... was an Indian politician and a senior leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) who served as prime minister of India for three terms (May 16–June 1, 1996; 1998–99; 1999–2004)....

title: Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee | Prime Minister of India
snippet: A veteran Parliamentarian whose career stretches over four decades, Shri Vajpayee has been elected to the Lok Sabha (House of the People) nine times and to the Rajya Sabha (House of the States) twice, a record by itself.

title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee: A Statesman, Poet & Visionary Leader
snippet: Atal Bihari Vajpayee was a statesman, poet, and the 11th Prime Minister of India, known for his inclusive leadership and commitment to democratic ideals. His visionary policies, including economic reforms and diplomatic initiatives, significantly ...

title: Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee | Bharatiya Janata Party
snippet: Shri Vajpayee was the first Prime Minister since Smt. Indira Gandhi to lead his party to victory in successive elections. Born on December 25, 1924, in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh to Shri Krishna Bihari Vajpayee and Smt.
